page.title: 09Farming in Stallingborough
page.content: Mostly arable land, consisting of Wheat, Barley, Oilseed Rape, and Vining Peas. The small amount of grassland produces beef cattle and fat lambs. Field sizes are usually 10 acres or much larger. Average yield per acre of crops: Winter Wheat 3tons, Winter Barley 55cwt, Oilseed Rape 25cwt, Vining Peas 25cwt. Technology plays an important part in producing yields and great reliance is placed on artificial fertilizer and chemical sprays. Land Drainage is also most important and channels are regularly cleaned. Most fields have been underdrained. The majority of farms are well equipped with machinery, including diesel powered tractors from 50HP to 150HP. Harvested produce is usually stored on the farm after harvest and sold during the year. App. employment is 1 man per 200 acres.
